Package com.rb.nonbiz.collections

Class RBCategoryMap<K,​V>

java.lang.Object
com.rb.nonbiz.collections.RBCategoryMap<K,​V>
public class RBCategoryMap<K,​V>
extends java.lang.Object
Like an RBMap, except that this also stores a value that's supposed to mean 'regardless of key'. For example, this is useful if you want to store trading notional by side (buy/sell), but also the total (i.e. regardless of category).

The valueRegardlessOfCategory does not have to use additive semantics, like it would with buy / sell notional. For example, we could be storing orders by order reason (TLH, rebalance, etc.) We may decide to double-count some.

This is very similar to RBMapWithDefault, but the semantics are different. The single value here has semantics of 'applies to the total', not 'if you don't find it in the map, use this'.

    • rbCategoryMap

      public static <K,​ V> RBCategoryMap<K,​V> rbCategoryMap​(java.util.Collection<K> keys, java.util.function.Supplier<V> defaultValueSupplier)
      Creates an RBCategoryMap with the supplied value under the specified keys, as well as the 'regardless of category' key. Typically, the default value supplier will return a new object (pointer-wise) for each key, but it will be the same in terms of contents, if the supplier is stateless, which it should be.

    • rbCategoryMap

      Creates an RBCategoryMap with the supplied value under the 'regardless of category' key, and with values for the other keys generated by a function.
